about.title: ABOUT ME
about.presentation: Started playing with web technologies as a hobby since middle school in 2009. Now, my hobby became my full-time job. I am looking for a job where I can benefit the team while still learning. I believe in the importance of code quality and good architecture. I am passionate about computer science, and I am a huge fan of mangas and video games.

tph.title: Jan 2017 – Jun 2019 | Full Stack Developer
tph.point1: Continuously developed a web platform in an agile environment
tph.point2: Worked on the improvement of the code quality, the continuous integration
tph.point3: Gradually migrated a legacy frontend from Twig to Vue.js
tph.point4: Trained new developers on Symfony and Vue.js
tph.point5: Stack: PHP Symfony 3.4, PHPUnit, Vue.js, Mocha, Webpack, Sass, Docker, Jenkins

unlv.title: 2016 – 3 Months | Developer Intern
unlv.point1: Developed from scratch two tools to manage the transportation research center in a team of three

junior.title: Junior ESIEE – A Junior Enterprise
junior.point1: Developed new tools to manage the association

shogun.title: Since 2016 | ES6, React, Redux, Electron, Travis
shogun.description: A manga reader for PC. Written with Electron. I learned a lot about React and Redux during this project. The core the app use a library I published to NPM: node-manga-parser.

bde.subject: Student Union website/tools
bde.title: 2014 | PHP, Symfony
bde.description: A collection of tools I made for the student union of my school. Written in PHP with Symfony, the project is still maintained today by my successors.
